answers.answer: Hi katie,If you are feeling vibrations in the back of your head, it can be due to some peripheral nerve pathology.This peripheral nerve pathology can be due to Diabetes, Prediabetes, Vitamin deficiency, and altered blood pressure status, any nutritional deficiency, and abnormal endocrine status, compression of nerve or impingement of nerve at time of exit from Vertebrae.I think you need to consult your PCP, test for your sugar status and simultaneously you can start OTC multi-vitamin supplements, following which you can see for disappearance of symptoms.If your symptoms do not improved, then you can consult a neurologist and decide regarding further course of action.Hope this helps.Bye.
I don't know what it all means.  I have tried to google some of what you said to get a clearer understanding.  If it persists I will go see my PCP.   Thank you for your response, Katie
Hi,Sometimes MSG which is commonly found in food products can cause vibrations in the head and so can anxiety and stress. Please avoid these and see if you feel better. Good luck!

question: I am 30 years old and I started having a small vibration in the back of my head.  Stays in the same spot,  comes and goes all throughout the day.  My husband thinks I am crazy.  Maybe I am.
title: Strange Vibration in the back of my head
